clinical_study.brief_title: Peer Support for Weight Loss Maintenance
clinical_study.official_title: Peer Support for Weight Loss Maintenance

collaborator.agency: National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (NIDDK)

brief_summary.textblock: The primary aim of this study is to test the efficacy of patient-provided treatment for weight-loss maintenance.

primary_outcome.description: Weight change (measured on a digital scale to the nearest 0.1-kilogram) from the end of the Phase I weight loss program to the end of the Phase II maintenance program, which is 18 months long.

secondary_outcome.description: Blood pressure (mmHg) from the end of the Phase I weight loss program to the end of the Phase II maintenance program, which is 18 months long.
Cholesterol (mg/dL) from the end of the Phase I weight loss program to the end of the phase II maintenance program, which is 18 months long.

arm_group.description: Contingent upon participants losing 5% of body weight or more in Phase I (weight loss) of this trial, participants will receive an 18-month patient-delivered behavioral weight maintenance intervention. Specifically, group sessions will be delivered by a mentor (i.e., successful weight loser) and weekly coaching will be delivered by a peer (other member of their weight maintenance group).

Contingent upon participants losing 5% of body weight or more in Phase I (weight loss) of this trial, participants will receive an 18-month reduced intensity behavioral weight maintenance intervention, delivered by a professional. The intervention will consist of 24 group sessions.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age between 18-75
- Body Mass Index between 25-50
- English Speaking
Exclusion Criteria:
- Report being unable to walk 2 blocks without stopping
- Are currently participating in weight loss treatment, have a history of bariatric surgery, or lost â‰¥5% in the past 6-months
- Are pregnant or plan to become pregnant within 1 year
- Report a heart condition, chest pain during periods of rest or activity, or loss of consciousness on the Physical Activity Readiness Questionnaire
- Report a medical condition that could jeopardize their safety in a weight control program with diet and exercise guidelines
- Report conditions that, in the judgment of the PI, would render them unlikely to follow the protocol (e.g., relocation, dementia, unable to read and write in English)
- Have no Internet access.
